snippet: Despite the increase from July 2014, the deficit is still on track for the lowest full-year number in eight years.
abstract: Treasury Department reports federal budget deficit rose in July to $149.2 billion, up from deficit of $94.6 billion one year earlier; Congressional Budget Office forecasts 2015 deficit will fall to about $425 billion.
lead_paragraph: Despite the increase from July 2014, the deficit is still on track for the lowest full-year number in eight years.

headline.main: U.S. Budget Deficit Rose in July, but 8-Year Low Is Expected for Year
headline.print_headline: U.S. Deficit Rose in July, but Forecasts See Progress
